text: Bay11-7082 inhibits pro-IL-1beta production in response to P . aeruginosa
In addition to inhibition of NF-kappaB activity , Bay11-7082 can also directly inhibit the NLRP3 inflammasome [ 38 ] .

To validate its use in this study as an NF-kappaB inhibitor , western blots for pro-IL-1beta were performed alongside inhibition of CFTR activity by CFTRinh172 in response to PAO1 at 4 hours after stimulation ( Fig . 7a ) .
Our results indicate that Bay11-7082 prevents production of pro-IL-1beta whereas CFTRinh172 does not seem to affect it .

This was further corroborated by the ability Bay11-7082 to inhibit <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> degradation at 0.5 , 1 , and 1.5 hours post PAO1 stimulation ( Fig . 7b ) .
